intro: Melocactus amoenus, commonly known as the pink melon cactus, is a species of cactus native to southern Mexico. It is characterized by its spherical or cylindrical stem, which is often covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its roots are shallow and adapted to absorb moisture quickly from the soil. Melocactus amoenus is well-suited to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
